result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric D Webb was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
*Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
*Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
*Pay all supervision fees.

*No firearms. No voting.
*Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
*Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

*No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
*No alcohol or controlled substances.
*No driving without valid license.

*Cooperate with agent.
*Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended.
*Follow all rules of extended supervision.

*AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
*Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

timeConds.notes: *As a condition of probation, Court ordered defendant serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, 1st 3 Months straight time, 2nd 3 Months with Huber release privileges for work and treatment. Defendant to be allowed 2 days credit time served on the final 3 months. Good time credit. Defendant to report to the House of Corrections by 3/4/2016 at 5:00 p.m.
*Defendant to complete 50 hours of community service.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric D Webb

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eric D Webb in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence. Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 3 YEARS with the following conditions for probation and extended supervision:

If Revoked, Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.


CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION / PROBATION:
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-No driving without valid license
-Defendant to complete 50 hours of community service
-No firearms
-No voting
-As a condition of probation, Court ordered defendant serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, 1st 3 Months straight time, 2nd 3 Months with Huber release privileges for work and treatment. Defendant to be allowed 2 days credit time served on the final 3 months. Good time credit. Defendant to report to the House of Corrections by 3/4/2016 at 5:00 p.m. 

Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, received and filed.

Defendant Eric D Webb in court.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael Jude unable to appear due to a family emergency.  Matter adjourned for Sentencing.  Date slip given to the defendant.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eric D Webb in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.
Sentencing proceeded with statements from State, defense and defendant.  Court adjourns the sentencing for reports from defendant's counseling services.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
